docs.title: Skills
docs.text: The Magus skill API uses several terms, such as forms, techniques, and modifiers.

docs.title: Forms
docs.text:
A form is a fundamental type of movement or interaction with the environment. They are mainly used as building blocks for input. They are often applied to a specific target, which can be a chunk of bendable element or in some cases a creature, animal or plant.

While forms do not directly have an effect, basic Skills called Effects could made up by a single form. With a combination of Effects and Forms, you could compose complex techniques.

docs.title: Push
docs.text: Potential Effect: Pushes the target.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
VR: Push one or both arms away from the player.

Multikey: Mouse wheel away from the player.

docs.title: Pull
docs.text: Potential Effect: Pulls the target.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
VR: Pull one or both arms towards the player.

Multikey: Mouse wheel towards the player.

docs.title: Raise
docs.text: Potential Effect: Lifts the target.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
VR: Raise one or both arms up.

Multikey: Mouse motion up.

docs.title: Lower
docs.text: Potential Effect: Lowers the target.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
VR: Lower one or both arms.

Multikey: Mouse motion down.

docs.title: Burst
docs.text: Potential Effect: Violently shoots out the target, like a shotgun. The release of compressed force. More powerful than blast, but less controlled.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
VR: Thrust both arms out violently together, like a kamehameha.

Multikey: Left and right click simultaneously.

docs.title: Arc
docs.text: Potential Effect: Swirls the target around you. Useful for charging lightning or whips, or generating a protective field around you. A selected target is not required for this form, as shown by it being usable for lightning.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
VR: A general circular motion with both arms, like taichi.

Multikey: Mouse motion in a circle, Sneak.

docs.title: Compress
docs.text: Potential Effect: Compresses the target; E.g. into a sphere.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
VR: Hands slowly close in together, as if compressing something.

Multikey: Sneak, mouse wheel towards the player.

docs.title: Expand
docs.text: Potential Effect: Increases the size of the target. Although sometimes it might have the same effect as the focus modifier, they are not the same and can have varying effects.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
VR: Hands start together and slowly come apart, as if you’re tearing something.

Multikey: Sneak, mouse wheel away from the player.

docs.title: Twist
docs.text: Potential Effect: Twists the target. For example, it rotates a projectile.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
VR: Twist either or both of the player’s arms clockwise or anti-clockwise. Spin direction depends on what the technique requires; otherwise just flavour, intensity matters more.

Multikey: A>W>D>S twice; goes through directional inputs clockwise twice. Also works anti-clockwise.

docs.title: Strike
docs.text: Potential Effect: Strikes the target. Think air gust or fire blast. Can be modified for ranged, or left as is for melee.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
VR: Forceful motion with one arm in a direction.

Multikey: Left click.

docs.title: Block
docs.text: Potential Effect: Blocks from an attack by the target.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
VR: Hold down the block button and move the controller to meet a projectile. Other effects can be gotten by crossing your arms over your chest.

Multikey: Right click.

Note: This could be used in a Sekiro/Elden Ring-esque timed parry system.

docs.title: Breathe
docs.text: Potential Effect: Focuses energy within the user's chest. Useful for buff abilities, or techniques such as Ice Breath.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
VR: Arms together at sternum, then by sides in a martial arts pose (will find a picture later). Head down, then up, at the same time as the arm motion. Essentially exhale then inhale.

Multikey: Double tap Sneak, hold on the 2nd press.

docs.title: Step
docs.text: Potential Effect: Mobility in a direction parallel with the ground. Can be combined with other forms and modifiers to work in any direction.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
VR: Flick the VR motion controller joystick twice, or flick both wrists twice simultaneously in a direction.

Multikey: Double tap a direction.

docs.title: Element specific forms
docs.text: Elements can have forms unique to them.

docs.title: Modifiers
docs.text: A modifier is a simple piece of data that can be added by executing a form in a certain way.

docs.title: Common modifiers
docs.text: Common modifiers can be unlocked by anyone in a skill tree.

docs.title: Focus
docs.text: Charges the technique by holding down the form button.

docs.title: Multi
docs.text: Multiplies the technique by repeating the form button.

docs.title: Directional
docs.text: Aims the technique in a certain direction by walking that way. Additionally, there is a difference between "lower" and "upper", such as with a Fire Kick or a Block. By default, the direction is "upper", but it can be changed by holding down the Sneak key.

docs.title: Target
docs.text: Aims the technique at a target by looking at them.

docs.title: Special modifiers
docs.text: Special modifiers can be earned through various means, included out-of-game activities such as supporting the projects. These special modifiers include VFX and flavour finishers.

docs.title: Example
docs.text: An earth wall has a directional modifier, which specifies in what direction the wall appears. Earth spear has a target modifier, which means that you need to specify a target the spear should aim for.

docs.title: Techniques
docs.text:
A technique is a specific set of forms. This is the basic “move”. It consumes chi and has some kind of effect.

For example, think of earth wall as a technique that creates a wall of earth in front of the caster, or earth spear as a technique that launches a spear of earth at a target.

Techniques can be unlocked and upgraded in the skill tree.
